intro: Brachistus inaequilaterus, commonly known as the unequal-sided brachistus, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its leaves are narrow and often hairy, while its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in a cluster. Brachistus inaequilaterus is often found in open habitats such as shrublands and grasslands.
